fields.summary: wireframe behavior for when CF template contains no parms

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: no parameters should be a valid condition, so we need to allow that. [~jloza], how would the GUI look if no params are in the template? I assume no 2nd step and give option to create stack on 1st step in wizard?
fields.summary: stack creation fails when no parameters present in template

comments.body:
After discussing with [~dkavanagh], we agree that the best thing to do would be;
 - while on step one and loading the template, button stays disabled and button text says "Loading template..." and the loading spinner.
 - Once the template has been parsed, the button would enable and if parms, then it would read "Next"
 - if no parms, it would read "Create Stack" and skip step 2.

Confirming and opening linked UX ticket for wireframing.

[~jloza], I turned the above comment into a list I could check things off on. I question one thing. The first item says 'button text says "Loding template.." and loading spinner', but with the button disabled and the "reading template" w/ busy spinner in the summary section, is this really needed?
[~dkavanagh] did you check the wireframe? There were some things added between the first comment on this ticket and the wireframe.
OK, I think I've implemented what you mention in the notes at the upper right of the wireframe.
[~dkavanagh], can you point me to a template with no parms to use for checking this ticket, please?
tried loading from url and file, and errors galore. Screenshot from file upload, and JSON file, attached.
I ran against .117. I need a template that will work against that cloud to test this, please provide me with one that will work there, and instructions if needed.

Copy the template in the comment above into a text file. save it.
Use the stack wizard to create a stack, specifying the file you just saved as the template location. I've been using that with success.
That's what I did. We'll have to screen share on thursday.
UX review passed (only checked on Mac and Chrome, assuming [~dkavanagh] tested on all supported configs as part of his PR). Ready for code review.
Punting back to [~dkavanagh] to implement changes in PR comments.
merged this last week and just checked in pycharm and don't see any py or pt errors noted.

Tested in Shared Setup #1

Using the template in the comment above, created stack with no other parameters, successfully.
